intro: Pentaphragma pendulum, commonly known as the hanging mistplant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, pendulous inflorescences that resemble clusters of small, white flowers. Its leaves are typically ovate with a hairy surface, and it thrives in moist, shady environments. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to bloom throughout the growing season.
